title: Rent Burden: The 30% Rule
description: One-minute skill: Rent Burden: The 30% Rule.

hook.text: If you spend more than 30% of income on rent, you're officially 'cost-burdened.' Half of U.S. renters are.

buildup.text: The 30% rule became the standard for housing affordability in 1981, set by the federal government.

discovery.text: In New York, Los Angeles, and Miami, the average renter spends 40â€“50% of income on housing.

twist.text: Critics say the 30% rule is arbitrary. A high earner at 35% is fine; a low earner at 25% may still struggle.

climax.text: The rent burden crisis reflects a simple truth: wages haven't kept up with housing costs for decades.
